titles.title: Providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 99) revising the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2007, establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2008, and setting forth appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2009 through 2012.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-79, by Ms. Sutton.
Rule provides for consideration of H. Con. Res. 99 with 4 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions. Specified amendments are in order.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 36.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 275.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At conclusion of the debate on H. Res. 275, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Sessions demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on ordering the previous question until later in the legislative day.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 225 - 196 (Roll no. 202).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 229 - 197 (Roll no. 203).

bill.summary: 3/28/2007--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.Con. Res. 99 (congressional budget).
